evidence: Benchmarks are toy single-file tasks that do not model real production workloads.
impact: Benchmark numbers underrepresent real orchestration/editing complexity regressions.
recommendation: Add multi-file and tool-chain realistic benchmark scenarios.

evidence: Timer includes setup/teardown and not just agent execution latency.
impact: Timing signal is noisy and poor for regression tracking.
recommendation: Measure agent fix phase separately from deterministic harness overhead.

evidence: Each challenge runs once without warmup/repeats or variance reporting.
impact: Single-run timings fluctuate and hide subtle performance regressions.
recommendation: Run multiple iterations with warmup and report mean/stddev.

evidence: OAuth tests rely on fixed sleep delays instead of deterministic completion signals.
impact: Adds suite latency and introduces flakiness under slower CI conditions.
recommendation: Await real callback/event completion and remove arbitrary sleeps.

evidence: Memory leak test depends on external network calls to example.com.
recommendation: Stub/mocking fetch behavior for deterministic local test execution.

evidence: Benchmark permission allowlist has no regression test coverage.
impact: Future drift may silently widen shell permissions.
recommendation: Add explicit tests asserting strict benchmark permission matrix.
